name: Devansh

aboutpara: Hi, Iâ€™m Devansh Sharmaâ€”a computer-vision grad student at the University of Central Florida who loves turning messy, real-world data into working products. After earning an M.S. in Computer Science at Bowling Green State University, I spent a summer at Fellowship.AI building a pose-based activity-recognition pipeline that hit 96 % accuracy and shipped as an end-to-end demo. My research on evaluating object detectors for vulnerable pedestrians was accepted to IEEE ITSC 2024, reflecting my drive to push safety-critical CV forward. Beyond academia, Iâ€™ve spun up Kafka streams on AWS, orchestrated Airflow DAGs, and trained models that range from Extra Trees to YOLOv4. When Iâ€™m not experimenting with code, youâ€™ll find me mentoring undergrads as a teaching assistant or hacking on open-source projects. Iâ€™m excited by problems that blend solid engineering with thoughtful MLâ€”and Iâ€™m always looking for teams that value curiosity, clean code, and measurable impact.

resume.tagline: ðŸ‘‹  I'm a machine learning engineer, product designer, and a history buff.
resume.description: Iâ€™ve built an end-to-end pose-based activity-recognition pipeline that turns raw video into real-time action labels with â‰ˆ96 % F1, served through FastAPI on AWS. I curated a 20 k-frame benchmark of cyclists, pedestrians, and motorbikes, then evaluated YOLOv5, Faster R-CNN, and EfficientDet under rain, glare, and night conditions to steer ADAS safety choices. Most recently, I combined YOLOv4, DeepSORT, and projective geometry in a Dockerised micro-service that measures vehicle speed from a single traffic-camera feed to within Â±4 km/h, now powering a smart-city congestion pilot.

bullets: Developed and designed a pipeline that identifies one of 8 classes that incorporates different states of working out such body weight bearing, aerobic, stretching etc with 96.7 percent accuracy

Employed the use of Mediapipe or Blazepose that extract 3D coordinates per frame with normalizedv output between 0,1 and used these data points to train a Extra Trees classifier for activity classification.
Introduced RepNet for counting repetitions that enables more accurate recognition of any given activity
Performed testing to show difference between 2D and 3D Pose Estimation Model.

experiences.position: Data Analyst @ Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
bullets: Performing Data Annotation on large text data pertaining to classifications of excise duty notifications based on industry.
Created and automated the process of extracting appropriate data based on new government policy/ changes using scripts.
Performed pre-processing on text data using Regex in extracting the changing import duty data and creating domains in compliance with policy changes.

experiences.position: Teaching Assistant and Project Management @ Bowling Green State University, Ohio
bullets: Techaning Faculty for CS 1010: Python Programming
TA for CS 3350: Data Structures,  CS 2010: C++ Programming, CS 4620: DBMS, CS 5120: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
Managing Students, Proctoring Exams, Holding Office Hours.
Developed an Arduino based robot - integral part of campus sustainability project for waste management. Increasing robot efficiency for waste collection from 82% to 95%.
